posts.title: Welcome to Ghost
posts.markdown:
You're live! Nice. We've put together a little post to introduce you to the Ghost editor and get you started. You can manage your content by signing in to the admin area at `<your blog URL>/ghost/`. When you arrive, you can select this post from a list on the left and see a preview of it on the right. Click the little pencil icon at the top of the preview to edit this post and read the next section!

## Getting Started

Ghost uses something called Markdown for writing. Essentially, it's a shorthand way to manage your post formatting as you write!

Writing in Markdown is really easy. In the left hand panel of Ghost, you simply write as you normally would. Where appropriate, you can use *shortcuts* to **style** your content. For example, a list:

* Item number one
* Item number two
    * A nested item
* A final item

or with numbers!

1. Remember to buy some milk
2. Drink the milk
3. Tweet that I remembered to buy the milk, and drank it

### Links

Want to link to a source? No problem. If you paste in url, like http://ghost.org - it'll automatically be linked up. But if you want to customise your anchor text, you can do that too! Here's a link to [the Ghost website](http://ghost.org). Neat.

### What about Images?

Images work too! Already know the URL of the image you want to include in your article? Simply paste it in like this to make it show up:

![The Ghost Logo](https://ghost.org/images/ghost.png)

Not sure which image you want to use yet? That's ok too. Leave yourself a descriptive placeholder and keep writing. Come back later and drag and drop the image in to upload:

![A bowl of bananas]


### Quoting

Sometimes a link isn't enough, you want to quote someone on what they've said. It was probably very wisdomous. Is wisdomous a word? Find out in a future release when we introduce spellcheck! For now - it's definitely a word.

> Wisdomous - it's definitely a word.

### Working with Code

Got a streak of geek? We've got you covered there, too. You can write inline `<code>` blocks really easily with back ticks. Want to show off something more comprehensive? 4 spaces of indentation gets you there.

    .awesome-thing {
        display: block;
        width: 100%;
    }

### Ready for a Break? 

Throw 3 or more dashes down on any new line and you've got yourself a fancy new divider. Aw yeah.

---

### Advanced Usage

There's one fantastic secret about Markdown. If you want, you can  write plain old HTML and it'll still work! Very flexible.

<input type="text" placeholder="I'm an input field!" />

That should be enough to get you started. Have fun - and let us know what you think :)
posts.html:
You're live! Nice. We've put together a little post to introduce you to the Ghost editor and get you started. You can manage your content by signing in to the admin area at <your blog URL>/ghost/. When you arrive, you can select this post from a list on the left and see a preview of it on the right. Click the little pencil icon at the top of the preview to edit this post and read the next section!

Getting Started

Ghost uses something called Markdown for writing. Essentially, it's a shorthand way to manage your post formatting as you write!

Writing in Markdown is really easy. In the left hand panel of Ghost, you simply write as you normally would. Where appropriate, you can use shortcuts to style your content. For example, a list:

  • Item number one
  • Item number two
    • A nested item
  • A final item

or with numbers!

  1. Remember to buy some milk
  2. Drink the milk
  3. Tweet that I remembered to buy the milk, and drank it

Links

Want to link to a source? No problem. If you paste in url, like http://ghost.org - it'll automatically be linked up. But if you want to customise your anchor text, you can do that too! Here's a link to the Ghost website. Neat.

What about Images?

Images work too! Already know the URL of the image you want to include in your article? Simply paste it in like this to make it show up:

Not sure which image you want to use yet? That's ok too. Leave yourself a descriptive placeholder and keep writing. Come back later and drag and drop the image in to upload:

Quoting

Sometimes a link isn't enough, you want to quote someone on what they've said. It was probably very wisdomous. Is wisdomous a word? Find out in a future release when we introduce spellcheck! For now - it's definitely a word.

Wisdomous - it's definitely a word.

Working with Code

Got a streak of geek? We've got you covered there, too. You can write inline <code> blocks really easily with back ticks. Want to show off something more comprehensive? 4 spaces of indentation gets you there.

.awesome-thing {
    display: block;
    width: 100%;
}

Ready for a Break?

Throw 3 or more dashes down on any new line and you've got yourself a fancy new divider. Aw yeah.

Advanced Usage

There's one fantastic secret about Markdown. If you want, you can write plain old HTML and it'll still work! Very flexible.

That should be enough to get you started. Have fun - and let us know what you think :)

posts.title: MARBELLA VILLA WITH GLASS-BOTTOM INFINITY POOL
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Jellyfish-House-WAA-11-600x900.jpg)


This modern, eye-cathching residential property featuring an impresive rooftop swimming pool with glass-bottom floor, named as Jellyfish House was designed by  [Wiel Arets Architects (WAA)](http://www.wielaretsarchitects.com/en/projects/jellyfish_house/), located in Marbella, Spain.


![](/content/images/2014/Aug/3_003275image.jpg)

White-concrete house structure enhances the modern and sophisticated look of the Jellyfish House. 


![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Jellyfish-House-WAA-10-600x900.jpg)

Sunlight, which slips down through the pool pours thousands of glare, and at night lights creates fascinating look of surrounding.
A three-story building offers  five bedrooms, with two guest rooms, sauna and steam room, living area, kitchen and even such a cool feature as a service elevator that allows to send food from the kitchen to the roof top terrace and pool.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Jellyfish-House-section.gif)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/3_003258image.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/3_003246image.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Jellyfish.jpg)

The property tag price advertised as £9m ([source](http://dailymail.co.uk/travel/article-2617584/Dive-right-The-luxury-9m-Marbella-holiday-villa-stunning-glass-bottom-infinity-pool-built-ROOF.html))
posts.html:
This modern, eye-cathching residential property featuring an impresive rooftop swimming pool with glass-bottom floor, named as Jellyfish House was designed by Wiel Arets Architects (WAA), located in Marbella, Spain.

White-concrete house structure enhances the modern and sophisticated look of the Jellyfish House.

Sunlight, which slips down through the pool pours thousands of glare, and at night lights creates fascinating look of surrounding.
A three-story building offers five bedrooms, with two guest rooms, sauna and steam room, living area, kitchen and even such a cool feature as a service elevator that allows to send food from the kitchen to the roof top terrace and pool.

The property tag price advertised as £9m (source)

posts.title: STUNNING PLOUM SOFA
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/0f365e3a22643dc06dff5f406a6179b7.jpg)

Fantastic Ploum Sofa designed by Ronan & Erwan Bouroullec for Ligne Roset.
[Studio Bouroullec](http://www.bouroullec.com/) 
"We attempted to make a very comfortable, contemporary sofa. Ploum is an exercise in comfort and combines two materials: stretch-fabric upholstery and ultra-flexible resilient foam. The shape and vast proportions were specially studied to allow the whole body to recline in many different positions on the sofa’s supple, quilted surface without edges. Its seat is relatively low, we wanted it to be organic. We pictured Ploum like a ripe, voluptuous piece of fruit.Perhaps the use of a stretchy fabric is a symbolic parallel to a contemporary lifestyle, in which flexibility of use and comfort seem to us to be essential. "

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/f9e4887ae37ad61bab51c39c3c972bcd.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/1b0634e395a8aac2eff3702b72fa1a07.jpg)
posts.html:
Fantastic Ploum Sofa designed by Ronan & Erwan Bouroullec for Ligne Roset.
Studio Bouroullec "We attempted to make a very comfortable, contemporary sofa. Ploum is an exercise in comfort and combines two materials: stretch-fabric upholstery and ultra-flexible resilient foam. The shape and vast proportions were specially studied to allow the whole body to recline in many different positions on the sofa’s supple, quilted surface without edges. Its seat is relatively low, we wanted it to be organic. We pictured Ploum like a ripe, voluptuous piece of fruit.Perhaps the use of a stretchy fabric is a symbolic parallel to a contemporary lifestyle, in which flexibility of use and comfort seem to us to be essential. "

posts.title: MODERN FUTURE LOOK
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/oscar_240209_01.jpg)

The Oscar glass dinning table designed by italian architect & designer [Piero Lissoni](http://lissoniassociati.com) for the [GLAS Italia](http://glasitalia.com)- one of the most beautiful minimalist masterpiece.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/oscar_240209_02.jpg)

Ultra modern dining table is released in thin extralight glass, emphasizing clean lines form perfection.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/oscar_240209_03.jpg)

The very slender base, despite of an apparent fragility and fineness, is solid and resistant thanks to a special tempering treatment of the glass.
posts.html:

Ultra modern dining table is released in thin extralight glass, emphasizing clean lines form perfection.

The very slender base, despite of an apparent fragility and fineness, is solid and resistant thanks to a special tempering treatment of the glass.

posts.title: Campos Lake Studio Architects  02 Desert Dwelling in Mexico
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53b1880cc07a806b4b000140_zacatitos-02-campos-leckie-studio_campos_leckie_studio_-_zacatitos_02_-_07-749x1000.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53b1878cc07a80eb1c000178_zacatitos-02-campos-leckie-studio_campos_leckie_studio_-_zacatitos_02_-_01-1000x667.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53b1880ac07a80790f000149_zacatitos-02-campos-leckie-studio_campos_leckie_studio_-_zacatitos_02_-_05-diagram_copia-1000x635.png)

[Campos Lake Studio Architects ](http://camposleckie.ca) presents 02 Desert Dwelling in Mexico
Using a convertible architectural strategy this project strives to strives to provide a sense of inhabitation of the landscape which affords the luxury of being neither completely inside, nor entirely outside, but somewhere in between.  To achieve this, the primary living space features three walls with large operable glazing panels that fully retract, providing the effect of expanding the dwelling almost infinitely into the natural landscape beyond. The concrete topography of the dwelling dematerializes in fragments as it extends into the desert context. 


It presents a minimal architectural aesthetic wherein interior and exterior blend seamlessly, lightly demarcated by large operable glazing panels. The detail-oriented minimalism evoke an inevitability that is a direct reflection of the frugality and sparseness that is the ethos of this landscape.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53b187e3c07a80eb1c00017b_zacatitos-02-campos-leckie-studio_campos_leckie_studio_-_zacatitos_02_-_05-1000x749.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53b187d3c07a80790f000148_zacatitos-02-campos-leckie-studio_campos_leckie_studio_-_zacatitos_02_-_04-530x689.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53b1878cc07a80eb1c000178_zacatitos-02-campos-leckie-studio_campos_leckie_studio_-_zacatitos_02_-_01-1000x667.jpg)
posts.html:
Campos Lake Studio Architects presents 02 Desert Dwelling in Mexico Using a convertible architectural strategy this project strives to strives to provide a sense of inhabitation of the landscape which affords the luxury of being neither completely inside, nor entirely outside, but somewhere in between. To achieve this, the primary living space features three walls with large operable glazing panels that fully retract, providing the effect of expanding the dwelling almost infinitely into the natural landscape beyond. The concrete topography of the dwelling dematerializes in fragments as it extends into the desert context.

It presents a minimal architectural aesthetic wherein interior and exterior blend seamlessly, lightly demarcated by large operable glazing panels. The detail-oriented minimalism evoke an inevitability that is a direct reflection of the frugality and sparseness that is the ethos of this landscape.

posts.title: CUBRIC  Sideboard by RIFLESSI
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/cubric1.jpg)

CUBRIC  Sideboard by [RIFLESSI](http://riflessisrl.it) in walnut and aluminium mirror finish.

Cabinet in MDF 25 mm thick. Structure in American Walnut, doors and sides in aluminum bent by hand, frame and doors with 45 ° cut. Push-pull opening system. Bent by hand with Folding method. Diamond Mirror with aluminum frame bent by hand with Folding method.
posts.html:
CUBRIC Sideboard by RIFLESSI in walnut and aluminium mirror finish.

Cabinet in MDF 25 mm thick. Structure in American Walnut, doors and sides in aluminum bent by hand, frame and doors with 45 ° cut. Push-pull opening system. Bent by hand with Folding method. Diamond Mirror with aluminum frame bent by hand with Folding method.

posts.title: CASA LA PUNTA
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/LaPunta.jpg)

Aesthetic solid concrete house immersed into a rich vegetation of Bosques of the Lomos, Mexico City mesmerising by the harmony of arhitectural expresion.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/HouseLaPunta.jpg)

Two solid concrete volumes placed one over the other creating an "L" shape features main fouse structure.

Clear frameless glass walls makes illusion that solid concrete volume placed above is floating in the air.

Designed by [Central De Arquitectura](http://centraldearquitectura.mx).

posts.title: OPEN TO THE CITY
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53aa1290c07a8037b3000039_open-and-transparent-to-the-city-pitsou-kedem-architects_rachel_yanai_007-1000x666.jpg)


The spectacular, huge  Antokolsky Penthouse with rooftop pool designed by [Pitsou Kedem Architects](http://pitsou.com/) open to the city views of Tel Aviv, Israel.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Antokolsky-Pitsou-Kedem-view.jpg)
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Antokolsky-Penthouse-city.jpg)

The entire appartment surrounded by glass screen walls exposing magnificent panorama of the city life. Open plan layout creates contemporary space look, blurs bounders between outside and inside living.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53aa149bc07a8037b3000046_open-and-transparent-to-the-city-pitsou-kedem-architects_floor_plan-1000x707.png)


![](/content/images/2014/Aug/AntokolskyPitsou-Kedem.jpg)



![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53aa1414c07a8033bd00003f_open-and-transparent-to-the-city-pitsou-kedem-architects_rachel_yanai_075-1000x666.jpg)





![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53aa1412c07a8037b3000043_open-and-transparent-to-the-city-pitsou-kedem-architects_rachel_yanai_074-1000x630.jpg)

The kitchen area is organised so well that would make cooking just more enjoyable. Two minimalistic long kitchen islands in stainless steel and dark chocolate wood finishes are located one in front of another in the middle of the space, which allows to enjoy panoramic views of Tel Aviv from all the sides.  

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53aa13c1c07a8037b3000041_open-and-transparent-to-the-city-pitsou-kedem-architects_rachel_yanai_063-1000x542.jpg)



![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53aa138fc07a8033bd00003c_open-and-transparent-to-the-city-pitsou-kedem-architects_rachel_yanai_053-1000x590.jpg)

Interior pallette of grey shadess is braking up with geometry of matalick black lines the touches of yellow acents.


![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53aa12c5c07a8033bd000038_open-and-transparent-to-the-city-pitsou-kedem-architects_rachel_yanai_024-1000x666.jpg)


![](/content/images/2014/Aug/53aa12cac07a80e73200003a_open-and-transparent-to-the-city-pitsou-kedem-architects_rachel_yanai_025-1000x531.jpg)
posts.html:
The spectacular, huge Antokolsky Penthouse with rooftop pool designed by Pitsou Kedem Architects open to the city views of Tel Aviv, Israel.

The entire appartment surrounded by glass screen walls exposing magnificent panorama of the city life. Open plan layout creates contemporary space look, blurs bounders between outside and inside living.

The kitchen area is organised so well that would make cooking just more enjoyable. Two minimalistic long kitchen islands in stainless steel and dark chocolate wood finishes are located one in front of another in the middle of the space, which allows to enjoy panoramic views of Tel Aviv from all the sides.

Interior pallette of grey shadess is braking up with geometry of matalick black lines the touches of yellow acents.

posts.title: THERME VALS SPA BY PETER ZUMTHOR
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/tumblr_n6ap32bMUY1rqnvb7o4_500.jpg)
The Therme Spa is a stunning landmark built from 60 000 stone slabs of Valser quartzite in the Graubunden Canton in Switzerland.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/thumb.jpg)

PETER ZUMTHOR: "We decided to achieve the desired effect of the monolithic look of our blocks with a sort of "stone textile", and have designed a joint pattern, which allowed us to join the stones together to make a homogeneous looking wall. The joint pattern finally developed in many work steps is based on the principle layering thin stone panels in three different heights: 31, 47 and 63 mm. These three layer heights run through the whole bath from top to bottom. Layer on layer. Without exception."

![](http://media-cache-ec0.pinimg.com/736x/0c/22/d3/0c22d3ae3397512e7edbeacef4a0f944.jpg)


![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Therme-Vals-Switzerland-by-Peter-Zumthor-ideasgn-therapie.jpg)

“The meander, as we call it, is a designed negative space between the blocks, a space that connects everything as it flows throughout the entire building, creating a peacefully pulsating rhythm. Moving around this space means making discoveries. You are walking as if in the woods. Everyone there is looking for a path of their own.” Peter Zumthor
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/tumblr_n6ap32bMUY1rqnvb7o5_1280.jpg)
posts.html:
The Therme Spa is a stunning landmark built from 60 000 stone slabs of Valser quartzite in the Graubunden Canton in Switzerland.

PETER ZUMTHOR: "We decided to achieve the desired effect of the monolithic look of our blocks with a sort of "stone textile", and have designed a joint pattern, which allowed us to join the stones together to make a homogeneous looking wall. The joint pattern finally developed in many work steps is based on the principle layering thin stone panels in three different heights: 31, 47 and 63 mm. These three layer heights run through the whole bath from top to bottom. Layer on layer. Without exception."

“The meander, as we call it, is a designed negative space between the blocks, a space that connects everything as it flows throughout the entire building, creating a peacefully pulsating rhythm. Moving around this space means making discoveries. You are walking as if in the woods. Everyone there is looking for a path of their own.” Peter Zumthor

posts.title: GLASS HOUSE
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/red1.jpg)

Modern glass house by [Italian architect Carlo Santambrogio and designer Ennio Arosiso](http://santambrogiomilano.it) . The glass house built as a showcase for their line of transparent furniture.

Breathtaking fully exposed, see-through space, without any borders between a private life and the nature.The transparent  walls, ceilings, stairways melts together with glass furniture creating feeling of unique design.


![](http://media-cache-ec0.pinimg.com/736x/c8/8c/7c/c88c7c83391a460713672b54b7b27bad.jpg)

Just imagine lying on the bed and stare at the stars in before fall asleep, or waking up by seeing the sun and clouds in the clear sky blue sky.

![](http://www.housekaboodle.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/santambrogio-glass-house-dining-room-table.png)

How about to spend a time in the middle of the forest in winter, watching all trees in white.. and feeling warm and safe at home by having dinner, with italian glass of wine.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/santambrogio-glass-house-stairway.png)

Stairs to the heaven or to the future, all looks so cool and modern must be feeling like in a movie.
posts.html:
Modern glass house by Italian architect Carlo Santambrogio and designer Ennio Arosiso . The glass house built as a showcase for their line of transparent furniture.

Breathtaking fully exposed, see-through space, without any borders between a private life and the nature.The transparent walls, ceilings, stairways melts together with glass furniture creating feeling of unique design.

Just imagine lying on the bed and stare at the stars in before fall asleep, or waking up by seeing the sun and clouds in the clear sky blue sky.

How about to spend a time in the middle of the forest in winter, watching all trees in white.. and feeling warm and safe at home by having dinner, with italian glass of wine.

posts.title: ECHO BRICKELL BUILDING
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/a997c555fdcc25b36239af9019920a87.jpg)

[This new development](http://echobrickell.com/) of luxury homes in Florida is a boutique, residential high-rise right in the middle of central Miami’s fastest growing neighbourhood.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/phpThumb_generated_thumbnailjpg--2-.jpg)

Conceptual Design by [Carlos Ott](http:///carlosott.com) and interior design by [yoo Studio](http://yoo.com) combined with panoramic views of Biscayne Bay, Key Biscayne, and Miami Beach set high expectations and you will not be disappointed.

> With only 180 residences, this luxury Miami property is considered the most exclusive architectural icon south of New York. The exquisitely designed residences feature summer kitchens and top-of-the-line appliances. Expansive terraces bring the outside in and the apartment’s marble flooring throughout is a mark of quality. These limited edition of Miami luxury homes combine innovative architecture and modern, contemporary interior design to create a living space that is exquisite, exciting and truly unique.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/phpThumb_generated_thumbnailjpg--1-.jpg)

	The apartments range from 1 to 3 bedrooms and the penthouses from 3 to 4 bedrooms. The larger penthouses on the upper floor also include a separate maid’s quarter with bath.The residences feature panoramic water and city views and each residence will be delivered complete with interior design inspired by Carlos Ott + yoo. High ceilings and floor to ceiling windows reinforce the sense of space and light of the apartments and the spacious terraces provides for an indoor – outdoor lifestyle that will allow you to make the most of the wonderful climate.Smart home technology including integrated audio, video and lighting systems come as standard and pre-installed lighting system include recessed lighting, dimmers and lighting control.

Advertised on [International Luxury Real Estate](http://ilre.com/) showcases.
posts.html:
This new development of luxury homes in Florida is a boutique, residential high-rise right in the middle of central Miami’s fastest growing neighbourhood.

Conceptual Design by Carlos Ott and interior design by yoo Studio combined with panoramic views of Biscayne Bay, Key Biscayne, and Miami Beach set high expectations and you will not be disappointed.

With only 180 residences, this luxury Miami property is considered the most exclusive architectural icon south of New York. The exquisitely designed residences feature summer kitchens and top-of-the-line appliances. Expansive terraces bring the outside in and the apartment’s marble flooring throughout is a mark of quality. These limited edition of Miami luxury homes combine innovative architecture and modern, contemporary interior design to create a living space that is exquisite, exciting and truly unique.

The apartments range from 1 to 3 bedrooms and the penthouses from 3 to 4 bedrooms. The larger penthouses on the upper floor also include a separate maid’s quarter with bath.The residences feature panoramic water and city views and each residence will be delivered complete with interior design inspired by Carlos Ott + yoo. High ceilings and floor to ceiling windows reinforce the sense of space and light of the apartments and the spacious terraces provides for an indoor – outdoor lifestyle that will allow you to make the most of the wonderful climate.Smart home technology including integrated audio, video and lighting systems come as standard and pre-installed lighting system include recessed lighting, dimmers and lighting control.

Advertised on International Luxury Real Estate showcases.

posts.title: CUTTING-EDGE VILLA ESCARPA
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/1-2.jpg)

Breathtaking, elegant and contemporary architetural expresion, mesmerizing by pure strict geometrical forms. Cutting-edge Villa is located on a very steep slope overlooking coastline of Algrave in the South of Portugal. 

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/5.jpg)


Designed by [Mario Martins architect studio](http://mariomartins.com).
"We created sheltered terraces and courtyards for outside living. These are cut from the horizontal volume which is white and highly transparent. This volume gently sits upon an exposed concrete support giving the appearance of the house floating above the landscape. The touch on the environment, which we want to preserve, is minimized and resolves the difficult balance of the building with its physical support, this ensures a desireable visual lightness."

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/4.jpg)

Striking swiming pool crossing white sleek terraces and Villa's glass walls, lies down between internal spaces - the wide living room and kitchen spaces and extends to panoramic views of the meadows and the sea.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/11.jpg)

The stunning house offers five bedrooms, living areas, stylish kitchen, private screening room, games area and a 4-car garage.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/plan-villa-escarpa.png)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/10.png)
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/22.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/2.jpg)


The internal area of the house open and fluid. White, minimal, uncluttered space gives light, ultra-modern feeling for interior of the house.
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/1643174.jpg)

The stunning minimalist lounge and dining room are divided by a double-sided bioethanol fireplace.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/7.jpg)


The main spaces were constructed with glass walls that fully open up to the outside world.
 
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/8.jpg)

Dazzling white terrace accentuates the visual lightness of the floating building in its environment, suspended above town lights, meadows views.

Advertised for 3.7mln on [Luxury Property Algarve](http://www.luxury-property-algarve.com/).
posts.html:
Breathtaking, elegant and contemporary architetural expresion, mesmerizing by pure strict geometrical forms. Cutting-edge Villa is located on a very steep slope overlooking coastline of Algrave in the South of Portugal.

Designed by Mario Martins architect studio.
"We created sheltered terraces and courtyards for outside living. These are cut from the horizontal volume which is white and highly transparent. This volume gently sits upon an exposed concrete support giving the appearance of the house floating above the landscape. The touch on the environment, which we want to preserve, is minimized and resolves the difficult balance of the building with its physical support, this ensures a desireable visual lightness."

Striking swiming pool crossing white sleek terraces and Villa's glass walls, lies down between internal spaces - the wide living room and kitchen spaces and extends to panoramic views of the meadows and the sea.

The stunning house offers five bedrooms, living areas, stylish kitchen, private screening room, games area and a 4-car garage.

The internal area of the house open and fluid. White, minimal, uncluttered space gives light, ultra-modern feeling for interior of the house.

The stunning minimalist lounge and dining room are divided by a double-sided bioethanol fireplace.

The main spaces were constructed with glass walls that fully open up to the outside world.

Dazzling white terrace accentuates the visual lightness of the floating building in its environment, suspended above town lights, meadows views.

Advertised for 3.7mln on Luxury Property Algarve.

posts.title: LET'S LAND ON VILLA CHAMELEON IN MALLORCA
posts.markdown:
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Chameleon-Villa-Spain.jpg)
If you are "James Bond" type of person this villa is perfect for you. Just imagine yourself flying over by the helicopter and lending on the personal helicopter deck by the rooftop swimming pool of your luxury house.
The 6.497 m2 Villa with views of the sea, the city, and the harbor of Palma  can be founded in famous area of Son Vida, Mallorca surrounded by wonderful Mediterranean sea nature.
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/02e8ca2ad17d56e17e1fc2edcbee4d40_photo_616x924.JPG)


Its a chic place where you could go with family or invite bunch of friends and spend unforgetable time by having parties or relaxing by the Spanish sun.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/8e612__VILLA-CHAMELEON-Ultra-Luxurious-Modern-in-Mallorca.jpg)

The property consist of three buildings : the main house, the guest house and welness/fitness building. Features 10 bedrooms, 9 bathrooms, hudge modern living area, dining, built-in kitchen, library, cinema, wine cellar, heated swimming pools, gym, jacuzzi and sauna..offering all you can wish for relaxing or having unforgetable party under Spanish sky. 

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/helicopter-pad---villa-chameleon.jpg)

The reflextions of fowless glossy white creates interior spaces more light and modern luxury feeling.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/ChameleonVilla-white-interior-living-room.jpg)

White calm interior palete inframes Mediterranean nature and invites you to enjoy its breathtaking views.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/dining-room--chameleon-mallorca-.jpg)
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Villa-Chameleon-white-kitchen.jpg)
![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Villa-Chameleon-led-feature.jpg)

Thanks to fascinating programable LED technology property was named Villa Chameleon. Almost in every room lighting colours can be change depending on the mood. This extraordinary feature adds to property cool and chic living charm.

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Villa-Chameleon-led-feature2.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Villa-Chameleon-led-features-3.jpg)

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/Villa-Chameleon-lights-.jpg)


Price is awailable on request on [Engelvoelkers.com](http://www.engelvoelkers.com/es/mallorca/sonvida/son-vida/villa-chameleon-in-palma-de-mallorca-son-vida-w-00ab30-480924.62240_exp/?startIndex=0&businessArea=&q=&facets=&pageSize=10&language=en&elang=en)   , [Sothebysrealty.com](http://sothebysrealty.com/eng/sales/detail/180-l-975-sn9w77/chameleon-villa-architecture-and-design-palma-son-vida-ml-07013)

posts.title: OCEAN DEPTHS COFFE TABLE
posts.markdown:
![](http://media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/aa/84/0b/aa840b323ebcbcb9a4ade9fdfff0d848.jpg)

Remarkable masterpiece of creative, unusual furniture - the Abyss Table, designed by [Duffy London](http://http://duffylondon.com/) designers team, mimics a visual 3D geological map of an ocean abyss. 

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/the-abyss-table-by-duffy-london.jpg)

Dramatic depths of the ocean effect was achieved by overlaying sheets of wood and glass on top of each other. The thick glass darkened the more layers added, this effect used to show a piece of the ocean’s bed. The team spent a year experimenting with sculpted glass. 

![](/content/images/2014/Aug/the-abyss-table.jpg)


![](/content/images/2014/Aug/abyss-table-duffy77.jpg)

Designer Christopher Duffy describes: 
"I wanted to use this effect to replicate a real piece of the earth’s sea bed. Like a mythical power had lifted a perfect rectangle straight from the earth’s crust to use as his personal ornament.‘

![](http://media-cache-ec0.pinimg.com/736x/f4/8a/0b/f48a0bcd9d772d1c4fdc53f1dcac0a2d.jpg)


The Abyss Table is handmade from sustainable materials, and it’s limited to 25 editions. Advertised price: £9,800 ex.vat on [Duffy London.](http://duffylondon.com/product/tables/abyss-table/)
posts.html:
Remarkable masterpiece of creative, unusual furniture - the Abyss Table, designed by Duffy London designers team, mimics a visual 3D geological map of an ocean abyss.

Dramatic depths of the ocean effect was achieved by overlaying sheets of wood and glass on top of each other. The thick glass darkened the more layers added, this effect used to show a piece of the ocean’s bed. The team spent a year experimenting with sculpted glass.

Designer Christopher Duffy describes:
"I wanted to use this effect to replicate a real piece of the earth’s sea bed. Like a mythical power had lifted a perfect rectangle straight from the earth’s crust to use as his personal ornament.‘

The Abyss Table is handmade from sustainable materials, and it’s limited to 25 editions. Advertised price: £9,800 ex.vat on Duffy London.
